full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
===============

**Title (English/French):**
---------------

* TASK BASED INFORMATICS PROFESSIONAL SERVICES (TBIPS)
* SERVICES PROFESSIONNELS EN INFORMATIQUE CENTRÉS SUR LES TÂCHES (SPICT)

**Reference Number (English/French):**
------------------------------------

* PW-22-01014267
* PW-22-01014267

**Amendment Number (English/French):**
-------------------------------------

* Amendment #003

**Publisher:**
------------

* Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* Pêches et Océans Canada

**Notice Type:**
---------------

* Request for Proposal
* Demande de propositions

**Procurement Method:**
---------------------

* Competitive - Open bidding
* Concurrentielle - Invitation ouverte à soumissionner

**Scope of Work:**
----------------

The successful bidder will provide project management leadership, expertise, and experience for the initiation, planning, implementation, and project completion of complex, multi-team, and multi-platform Information Management - Information Technology (IM-IT) systems development projects and/or infrastructure design and implementation projects.

**Security Clearance:**
-------------------

* A Secret-level security clearance is required for this project.

**Bid Submission:**
----------------

Bidders are invited to submit their proposals to the Contracting Authority, Nathaniel Dorgbetor, at Nathaniel.Dorgbetor@dfo-mpo.gc.ca. The deadline for submission is January 18, 2023, at 14:00:00.

**Important Notes:**
-----------------

* This tender is open only to qualified Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Supply Arrangement (SA) holders.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language.

Contact Information:
-------------------

* Nathaniel Dorgbetor, Contracting Authority
* Email: Nathaniel.Dorgbetor@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
* Phone: 819-665-7327

---

Note: The original text had multiple headers in French and English, but for the purposes of the rewritten entry, I kept the English headers with French translations in the description for clarity. I removed unnecessary text, rephrased complex sentences, and condensed the information while keeping the essential details. The rewritten entry meets the 400-word limit.
